Hi Keaton, 

Yes, I was referring to the layouts section in the tutorial notebook. Even after reading that section over multiple times, I only had a vague understanding of what layouts were. Also, it was not helpful to see some of the outputs of the methods \(e.g. the one that prints out a list of layouts, grid space, and local\), because I didn’t have much intuition for what these variables were or what to expect. 

I was just looking at the paper, and found figure 5 very useful. I think having something like that would be very helpful to new users.  

  
I do want to note that I have never built a parallelized model, so it is possible that a lot of this terminology would be common jargon that I don’t know.
